segments.text: The water is everywhere, and it’s making me so anxious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes like nothing is happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see the puddle growing, and it’s making my stomach twist.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being so careless, climbing on that stool like it’s nothing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just know someone is going to slip and fall, and it’s going to be bad.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far, and the stool is wobbling—it’s terrifying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t look away, but I can’t help either.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is completely unaware, and it’s making everything worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I’m watching a disaster unfold in slow motion.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to scream at them all to be more careful.
segments.speaker: PAR
